hackathon-description-text: Calling all scientists, software engineers, policy makers, designers, and entrepreneurs: please join us for the 3rd annual BERC Cleanweb Hackathon! The goal of the hackathon is to address a resource problem (energy, land, or water) using visualizations or software. Food and beverages will be provided by BERC.
hackathon-requirements: You can submit between 5pm and 5:30 pm on Saturday.
hackathon-rules:
Submissions judged only on content developed during hackathon period: Friday 6:30pm to Saturday 5pm.
All code must be submitted to a repository on Github to verify time of edits.
All teams must deliver a 4 minute presentation 2 mins of Q&A from the judges and audience. 
All submissions must be related to energy or resource (climate, land, air, water) topics.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best visualization to support policy and action
Best software addressing barriers to progress

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Doe Memorial Library, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, CA 94704, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Must make a positive impact on an energy, water, land, air, or climate issue. Describe your impact, and quantify potential impact, if possible.
How much code were you able to write in support of your project? What types of tools did you employ?
Did you address a policy issue/barrier within energy & resources?
Have you thought about next steps if you were to continue this project?

hackathon-location-address: Doe Memorial Library, University of California, Berkeley, Berkeley, CA 94704, USA
hackathon-description-header: Data + Software + Policy = A very Berkeley hackathon
